6h2UoEeBCsA56tGtRsbUnw.text: We went with a party of 12 to eat for Easter. The service was bad, the food was stale and at the end of our bill we made sure to tip for gratuity, but one of the workers with a blue shirt accused us for not leaving any tip when clearly it was on the table. He chased us and made a scene which was extremely embarrassing, we made sure other customers knew of the situation. Very disappointed, have never been in a disrespectful establishment in my life.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States

5ExDidhf7-V5hmBfTvbEyA.text: This is the second time we visited here. We heard about this place as great dimsum place from our friends. Dimsum is served during lunch only. I am not a big fan of dimsum so I am giving this review based on my wife's opinion. It was not the best dimsum that we ever had. But considering this is non metro area, it was good enough that we would go back. Their egg tart were really good. Make sure you try these.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Dimsum

LJ1ni34_DUp3Al6SifdYEQ.text: MAKE A RESERVATION if you're going for dim sum on Sunday.   Once you sit the parade of food never stops. Wish there had been more meat without dough choices. Also, had to stop a random kid to get water and tea. All the foods were tasty and hot (when appropriate).   Congee was yummy

SFMqdPm4m9scPPBMYnP-VA.text: Really enjoyed myself today with a group of friends including fellow #YelpElite Suhas, most of us had never eaten Dim Sum before. I was one of them, so I had no expectations going in, except seeing carts on carts of food around. This is definitely what we got at Phoenix Palace!  One of our friends set up a reservation so our group  wouldn't have to wait, most recommended since it gets busy super early. We had the perfect table that fit everyone comfortably, right smack dab in the middle of the restaurant. The cart ladies are a-plenty!   Literally the cart ladies started surrounding our table once a majority arrived. Kind of overwhelming to have all of them descend on us like that and none of us know what to order except for our main organizer who made all of the ordering decisions. Whatever he picked for us though was amazing! Dumplings, rolls, noodles, meats, EVERYTHING was delicious. I wouldn't be able to tell you what I ate, but it was crazy good. And then someone thought up the idea to get a plate of chicken feet for anyone to try. Dont think I will eat that again, ever.   The cart ladies were most excellent at going around the restaurant and asking if we wanted more. The desserts are generally sweet rolls and I forced myself to only eat one (curse you carbolicious bread!).   In total we ate for $14/person with tip and it was worth every penny. We all brought cash so the check could be split evenly. Cannot wait to come back and experience dim sum again!

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Amazing dumplings!
Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Really good rolls

GKha_aI44n0f5QUAq-0RqA.text: Overall, 3.5 stars Food: 4/5 Service: 3/5 Cleanliness: 3/5 Price: 4/5  I have been to Phoenix Palace at least 10 times, and I have a pretty consistent experience each time. This is one of the only options for dim sum in Phoenix, so I would recommend this place for dim sum in Phoenix.  Food: This place is like a traditional dim sum restaurant with carts being pushed and you order off of the items that are on the cart. I usually order in Mandarin, and this works for me, but I know they can also speak English, but this might be a bit more difficult. Some of my favorites are the shao mai, the dou hua, and chicken feet. They have a huge selection of food that you can get, so I suggest you go with more people, so you can try out more food.  Service: Especially during the weekend, the service can be patchy. Usually, carts show up as you are trying to sit down, even if I'm still waiting for people to show up. So I do feel al little rushed at times. Also, the restaurant is a bit crowded, so when there are carts being pushed around all the time, it does get a bit claustrophobic. And I have had issues where the carts didn't have what I wanted, so sometimes you have to ask someone who isn't pushing a cart to get an item for you. Dim sum is about immediately available food, this kind of ruins the flow of the meal.  Cleanliness: Not the cleanest, on par with most Chinese restaurants.  Price: Usually a great price! Get enough to be full, and price comes out to about $10 per person in my experience. Different items/carts are worth different prices, so if you're concerned, just ask.

UdUewwzPoceNav57ptHKTA.text: I am so happy I found this place for my dim sum fix. Having moved from Washington DC I had dim sum whenever I desired it. Now that I am in Phoenix, AZ, it's harder to come by dim sum. I am so thankful I found this restaurant to satisfy my Sunday dim sum needs. The dim sum is very fresh. It's pushed around on a cart and made fresh. My favorite dish here is their tofu fan. Tofu fan is  sweet soft tofu dessert. I highly recommend it from here. Their tofu fan syrup has a subtle yet shockingly fresh ginger taste.   Please take a look at my photos to see their presentation. In addition, please ask me any questions, that is, if you have any!

Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States

fI-xjWocqfN_gi4Fb7il8Q.text: I went here for a late dinner. It was me and a couple of friends. We ordered half crispy chicken, beef and veggies, string beans, mongolian beef, and soup. Everything was really good especially the crispy chicken. Customer service was ok, took awhile to get refills on our drinks, but all in all in was good. I usually come here for dim sum because I think their dim sum is pretty good, better than most places I been to in AZ. So, if you are going to try this place, go for their dim sum first!

o92z1URLGrc-aiIeZAnIeA.text: This place is good. Large selection of plates, and my usual favorites also. Went with the family.  It was nice. Not that you'd write home about it, but service was good, the food was good and not as much sodium as some other places.   I will be back.

X4Yr9obTnW1gD58jkhEmlQ.text: We were at Lee Lee market,  looking for things to eat, saw this one, it's said best dim sim in Az, so we went in. My husband likes shao Mai, so we had two tray. And shrimp dumplings, tou fu veggies, spring rolls, sticky rice chicken. Pretty good! Just the shrimp dumplings are too sticky, all stick to the pan.

UIaHfUtTUlw-Ov1vOrNJQA.text: My husband and I went to Phoenix Palace this afternoon for Dim Sum and had a great meal. Neither of us are Dim Sum veterans. Being from Northern California originally I have been to a few places, but it was my husband's very first time. The staff was very friendly and the food was great! My husband, a picky eater, especially loved the sesame buns with red bean filling and the buns with egg custard. There are 2 reasons why I didn't give it 5 stars. I was especially looking forward to Xiao Long Bao, better known as soup dumplings. I read that they served them here, but when the carts were circling they were nowhere to be found. They are my absolute favorite dim sum so that was a bit disappointing. The other reason I didn't give it 5 stars was that we felt a bit overwhelmed. As soon as we were seated every single cart came up to our table and waited in line to pitch us their dishes. They would ask repeatedly if we wanted the same dishes after we said no before they walked away. It would have been a bit nicer of an experience if they were circulating more a gave us a chance to breathe a bit. All and all though we had a wonderful experience. Delicious food, and the price is great! We could have easily fed 4 with the amount of food we got (we wanted to try a bit of everything) and ended up with lots of leftovers to box up and take home. Friendly people, yummy food, fun experience! We will definitely be back, and hopefully next time I will get my soup dumplings!

6Otrg3Nf6TTw4O3_wkKqrA.text: BEWARE CUSTOMERS when going to this shady Chinese Restaurant during DIM SUM hours. So we went to lunch today. 3 adults and one child-18 months old. When the final bill came I noticed 4 GUEST $2.63 charged onto my bill. I asked what this was for since we didn't order any hot tea. The cashier said that it's a SERVICE FEE we all have to pay for this she said. I said for what? The FEE goes towards SAUCES you use on the table, Cleaning table clothes-we have to pay to have them washed she said and towards cleaning of the kitchen as well as amongst other things. I told her that it was bull crap. That's wrong. I told her I'm from the East Coast and no where do they do this in NY, Boston, Chicago or San Francisco Chinatown. Then she said the sign is here listed that we can add the fee to your bill. That sign was posted at the register after you have already paid. That's ENTRAPMENT!!! I will never go back. By the way my baby who was 18 months old had  to pay that service fee. He didn't even eat or drink anything from that place.

swwHd7CCRrbSwFNWWOjFYA.text: Okay, I know Chinese restaurants are not known for their cleanliness but what happened today is really a new low for me.  The dim sum lady put a plate of beef rice roll on the table.  It was fresh so that was good.  It was not cut but I was fine with that.  She proceeded to cut it with her scissors.  Since there was no soy sauce on it yet, I noticed that her scissors left all these black specks in the rice rolls.  I told her the scissors were dirty but she continued to try and pick the specks off WITH her scissors!  It only made it worse.  I told her I don't want that plate anymore and she said no, I can't return it.  I was about to ask for the manager until she finally took it back and off my bill.  She put that plate back on the cart, now with soy sauce.  Onto the next customer?!

HYUy4acqvNiFn5j9_37LcA.text: Of course you cannot compare to dim sum places in the west or east coast but for AZ it's pretty decent. Best to go on weekends. More customer means more variety and fresh dim sum. Weekday choices were pretty weak...

Xmz9s3RjYRs079prZnYaZg.text: For Arizona, this is one the best place! Yes, there are other places in the world that have better dim sum, but for Phoenix, AZ this is one of the best. It can be crowded over the weekends, but there is a high turn over of that it speeds up the wait time. The food is delicious and there is a good variety and dessert assortments.

5NeNAAAm2VPdIRSU9G7aTw.text: I can here not knowing what to expect. I left full and happy. Many traditional items were on the menu as well as a few specialties. Make sure you get there early or you will have a long wait.

BysRDeIphT1PJ8Z6XdhBnQ.text: In Mesa/Gilbert/Chandler area, this place is as good as it gets for dimsum. Coming from southern CA with delicious dimsum, I would say the choices here are decent, the table arrangements are pretty comfortable, and the setting is friendly and full of families. It's a great place for an outing or a casual event and just sipping tea (we ordered the Chrysanthemum Tea with flowers).  Actually, the best thing about this restaurant is the price. It's affordable. I came with 6 people total and we ate our hearts out. The price came out to be no more than $11 including tip per person.   Only tidbit is I enjoy flavored food, and the food here is a little more bland than I prefer. Request some yellow mustard and chili spices to dip your dishes in and flavor up your food!

16RJHPFGLMkZvGCI-AMRCA.text: Yippee!! I finally found a nice dim sum place near where I live. I am impress at the way their service is managed. The staffs are always on the look out to clear your empty dishes or any service that they can provide. The carts moves around the restaurant continuously and you definitely don't see their staffs standing around and talking. We were presented with our choices of dim sum almost as soon as we sat down on our booth. Their tables were arranged in a very spacious manner, unlike most dim sum restaurants where you always have to move your chair when the cart comes around.   All the dishes we tried were excellent - har kaw, siu mai, Shanghai dumpling, chao mi fen. They are definitely generous with their filling because every piece is very juicy and delicious rather than flour-like. The cook will occasionally comes around with a dish or two that was freshly prepared. Their yam cake is served straight from their portable grill on a cart. My favorite dish that morning is their egg tart. It is THE BEST egg tart I have ever had. The crust is crispy and flaky and the egg custard has a smooth consistency and just the right amount of sweetness.  Their pricing is also very reasonable at $2-$3 per dish. I wish there were more of us so that I could try more things. I will definitely visit again to try different things.

I6GqFbhPPdMW1ncbCbMOeQ.text: We eat here at least twice a month.  There are two things that set this place apart from most other dim sum restaurants in America, never mind just in Phoenix.  1. A chef who loves to bake.  The head chef, Sam, is constantly baking up really delicious specials.  These are typically sweets/desserts and they are awesome.  He will come out to the tables on a busy weekend with a hot baking sheet full of pastries.  If he offers, by all means, take some!  2. Extremely accommodating service.  We take all of of friends there and that includes some very picky eaters, as well as kids.  I've never seen any restaurant go to such lengths to make sure everybody is happy, including making all kinds of off-menu items to satisfy the pickiest eaters.  Bottom line, it rocks!

zDL9QP0JVT7-baoPokZHBg.text: This is not a buffet.  I went in on a Tuesday 7 PM. The place was dead.  I got the hot and sour soup which was pretty good. 5.95. Pretty good portion. Split between 3 people.  XO sauce spicy fried rice... NOT spicy at all. Very bland. Probably won't get that again.  Assorted veggies plate with rice... it was okay. Wasn't the best I ever had but not bad either.  Service was kind of slow, as it took a while to get seated when there was nobody else in the restaurant, and longer than I would like for them to take my order.  You have to ask for ice waters if you want it otherwise they won't give it to you. You only get tea :p  They pour your tea for you and serve your soup for you which is kind of nice.  But the food... nothing too special to drive a long way for.  Overall, I don't think I will go again, but I guess its a good place to get to go stuff if you're into that.  I also noticed they do dim sum till 3 PM.

G4Z0Jq_YhP-RZFrVWr9h5w.text: This place is great, it's a pretty big dim sum restaurant! They service here is friendly and funny. They will crack jokes with you and make sure you get what you want. The varieties of choices for dim sum is always amazing and they all always hot and fresh for you, unless other places where you'll eat a cold bun! YUCK! I came here after a new years night out and loved it! I would definitely come here again!!

nMUqrVbiQHQDSYiOI4PmmQ.text: I love this place!!! The best dim sum I've had so far since I've started living in AZ! The food is good and the place is very spacious, not over crowded like the one in PHX..

mU64hl4gkbYsxPm8VKVVOw.text: I go to Phoenix Palace almost every Sunday, and generally I like the place, it serves great Dim Sum. Except, today I ordered the Shark Fin Shu Mai and right when I put it in my mouth, it was extremely sour. I order that dish many times and it has yet been sour. I knew that the food has gone bad. The waiter gave me a refund, but I am still disgusted by the thought of serving customers inedible foods. From earlier today, I have gotten food poisoning and have not been able to eat so thank you.

8mIpI200i5tl_9oCLolx_w.text: Good dim sum during the weekend. Some of the food (such as the green beans and spring rolls) are cold. The spring rolls are good enough that you do not mind eating them cold, but the green beans stir fry just taste bad when you eat them cold. They have more variety and the service is actually better during the weekend. Do not go during the week.

cYKVSImazs0PHtYiES_5MA.text: Went there for dinner and ordered 3 dishes. Overall the food was decent.  Nothing too exciting or special. I probably enjoyed the free soup that came with the dinner more than the dishes. I may go back to try their dim sum one day.

arz28kLv-dHw-8xVETgtbw.text: This is my favorite dim sum restaurant in the valley. If you come on a Sunday during prime time you'll get the freshest food, largest selection, and best service. There are carts being wheeled nonstop between the tables. It makes for a fun outing with family and friends. If you're adventurous, you may want to try authentic dishes like chicken feet. If not, there are plenty of dumpling and noodle options, and sweets too. It's not as robust as dim sum in San Francisco Chinatown but it fully satisfies my craving for dim sum. Just don't show up after 2pm because you'll only have 'leftovers' to choose from - they stop adding to the carts once the crowd dies off.

WI3EmhWNm81C7AlddkDeLA.text: It has too many reviews about the Dim Sum already. So I bet everyone would love to hear about the dinner menu in Phoenix Palace. It is delicious and full of varities from fisj, chicken to pork. I tried the steam talipia fish and vegies soup with half of the ducks. They are super delicous and fresh. I am really enjoying to eat here. They also have great customer service and really care for what the customer want.

m3cDljRKWJokZqRmKSmtIg.text: I love that this location serves dim sum via cart every single day, not just on the weekend. And they offer the full assortment, not some skimpy version of the weekend menu.   On this particular visit, I was passing through Phoenix on my way home. Nothing like having a mean craving for dim sum in the middle of the week.   I arrived before the doors even opened. Once in, I was swiftly seated and provided water. Within minutes, the first cart came around. I figured I would be the only person there for hours. But, no, not so. Groups started pouring in about 20 minutes later. By the time I left, there were numerous tables seated with larger groups.   Now, we all know that it is impossible to eat dim sum solo. Like, ridiculous impossible! But I wanted my dim sum now! So, solo I went. This meant, of course, that I didn't get a chance to order as much as I would have preferred.   I found that everything was absolutely fresh, and the portion sizes were a tad bit larger than I was accustomed. Nice but, again, I was trying to go for as many things as possible. In the end, I had five orders and wasn't able to finish off every bite of food. And there was a slight miscommunication over a special order, which was somewhat disappointing, but turned out to be OK. Thank goodness I am open to trying out different types of things.   My recommendation -- go! You may have to wait a long, long time on the weekend for a table. But it will be well worth the wait. Just be sure to take a sizable group along with you so that you are able to try as many items as possible.

iC8HTN7ElyDGha8Eeh8KkA.text: If you like Dim Sum you must come here when in Phoenix. Lots of types of Dim Sum, boiled,  fried,  sweet, salty, veggies, and all come to your table. It was pretty crowded and had a 15 to 20 min wait. As other Dim Sum places, it is busy and noisy. They serve take out two.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States

LU3eG9ztqLFAUkaenSPkYQ.text: It is my first time at here. Service is good. There have food I like. I would to come back again. Yummy .

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Dim sum

ezQmOYU7H21faQIOzuAEwA.text: Went for their Dim Sum and it was fantastic! It was my first time at this restaurant, and my first time having Dim Sum. I went by myself, so I was a little worried, based on other reviews, that I wouldn't be able to communicate well with the staff, but honestly I had no troubles. Food was fantastic, service was decent, and I didn't have any difficulties navigating the ordering system! Check this place out, it was a great experience!

luptVrIGvj18gmQqN-EO4A.text: For the price, I'd say the dim sum is standard, nonetheless still delicious. I would recommend takimg a friend here for breakfast or lunch

FN9th2CnYepXYl5XNuNhIA.text: It's a typical dim sum place with a good amount of options and an additional menu to order food. The decor is a little outdated, and the bathrooms could be better.

H2NafK5-ql6rLNuIvqFycw.text: First dim sum place I have tried in the area so I cannot compare to other. However, compared to other dim sum restaurants in the SF Bay Area, it could hold its own.  Good variety, food came out nice and hot. One of the servers pushing the food carts even told us which selections were hot and fresh versus a older and cooled off. Each dish had its own proper flavor meaning not all the dishes tasted the same which some places do.   Although, I must add the comment that their selection is a bit limited, but heh, it's Tempe, AZ not San Francisco, CA.  Overall service was quick and courteous; I would say a bit better than your typical Chinese servers. I would come again and recommend to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Typical variety

uBeAbd1c4kMB10dTXwyVuw.text: My hometown is in Canton, China, and the dim sum here really reminds me of the flavor I miss. I have been here almost every month since I knew this place, and usually I order the chicken feet, pork ribs, Gai Lan, the beef meat balls, , and other things, and they all taste yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States

6bfgEy5GangInkhMh5nKOw.text: This had so much potential, but alas, all the hype I heard about this place was not True. The dim sum itself is not spectacular. It's about as good as most other places I've been, but the selection wasn't very diverse. Maybe we went too early and not everything was out yet. It seems like that's the catch 22: either you arrive early to beat the crowd but have to wait for the good food, or you come later when the food is all ready but you have to wait forever to get seated. Actually, I'm not sure if we were too early for the good stuff or if they good stuff just never came our way; the hostess had seated our group all the way in the back, away from everyone else when the restaurant wasn't even close to being full yet. Seemed like a rather racist decision on their part because my group was predominantly non-East Asians.   Now that I think about it, the service was definitely bad enough to warrant a two-star rating. The ladies pushing the carts were really terse with me. I was ordering everything in Mandarin (because that's the only Chinese I speak) but since people in my group had dietary restrictions, I had to ask about the filling for the different types of dumplings and bao that went by. The ladies got really annoyed about me asking and were pretty rude. They also seemed angry when I asked for four boxes (one for each person) and rejected the two big boxes they initially handed me (even though I had asked for four small boxes to begin with).   Food-wise, it was okay. I've had better had other dim sum places, but my favourite dim sum restaurant in the valley closed, so this is kind of all I'm stuck with. Still, I feel bad for having brought my friends here to try it out. All the good stuff I heard about this place just aren't at all True. Disappointing, to say the least.

7-aj3tg_gwubx-rztyDkkQ.text: Food is mediocre ( at best) but service is pretty bad! The employees seem angry and like they don't want to work - and when I paid with my card the employee asked me where was the tip ?! It's on the table I replied....... Very BAD thing to ask and do! I've never been to a place where they hunt you for tips ( before even looking at the table) it just seem so unprofessional and impolite.  Better off at Mekong

BQmSd4d_o0kRd7S_McdFAA.text: My wife has a theory that if a restaurant is crowded, the fare is good and obviously the opposite scenario applies. I've tried explain that this doesn't always ap ally in the States.   It does here however. The four star rating is for the dim sum which ranks among the best in the city and draws a huge crowd. We went for dinner recently and found the restaurant deserted sans for the employees and the food was downright horrible. Two dishes were over cooked, all were under-seasoned, and the ingredients weren't fresh.   I highly recommend the dim sum; go elsewhere for dinner.

jdV9r81VAFv0_ume3GZcbw.text: The food is nice, especially the siu mai & shrimp puff, I'm just really particular with the service, there are some who are nice & approachable, but most of the staffs are pushy & very impatient because we cant understand & we cant choose what to get from the cart. Will never come back here again.

7mFz0xYK6L21AmSD3V28Cg.text: Went with the family for some dim sum and wanted to see if Phoenix Palace had gotten better since our last visit. Ordered some shrimp egg rolls, har gao, shu mai, chow mein and Baked BBQ pork buns. The egg rolls were really oily, the har gao had an odd flavor to the shrimp, and the shu mai didn't taste meaty (more fatty). The Baked BBQ pork buns were good though. The worst dish I had was the chow mein. It was severely overlooked and had no "dragon breath" flavor to it. If it were only the dishes I might have just given them an update of 2 stars but their customer service was horrendous.   Before we were seated my wife asked about an open table (4 seats) and why it was given to a party of 2 (we were a party of 3) that came after we did. All the person at the door directing people to tables said was WAIT A MINUTE in a very unapologetic and rude tone. When we were finally seated we waited a very long time before we even got our water. Many of the waiters and waitresses which we asked for water/tea either ignored us or just looked at us in disbelief.   Would highly recommend you look elsewhere for dim sum, unless you want poor dim sum quality and rude service. Looks like our time away has just given Phoenix Palace he opportunity to get much worse.

mO9nwHSU5U3rh5TX1ke1iQ.text: The place to be for weekend dim sum.  We like Char shue buns, gailan, chicken feet, egg custard tarts,eggplant with shrimp dim sum,and sticky rice..the best is Hong King style chow mein with seafood...the portion is too big for two people ,and we are not complaining because the leftovers makes for another meal for both of us. Families and friends are all enjoying snacks,and food that are wheeled around the restaurant. Don't know what something is,they will explain ..it's a once a month event for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States

lweI60EjLPtP0o5XY4MjIQ.text: Went in for dim sum with the kids. There was barely anyone in the restaurant. We ordered the usual- black bean spare ribs, shu mai, har gow, sticky rice, chicken feet and coconut buns. One lady came to our table in the beginning to offer steamed dishes and at the end I had to walk over to ask for the buns. I didn't get offered porridge or any soups... :(   Food and service were ok- maybe they had an off day?

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Left over spare ribs and chicken feet.

EWjl9zqHh4oK7BZC9dWuvA.text: *** This review is only for their Dim Sum *** After driving all over town for a dim sum, this is our favorite... they offer the basics in the traditional carts and they do it consistently well.  Amongst our favorites are: Lo Mai Gai, Har Gow, Har Cheug, Siu Mai  Xiao Long Bao, Char Siu Bao (baked & steamed), Hom Siu Gok, Eggplant stuffed with Shrimp, Daan Taat, Sesame Balls, Sponge Cake (Mai Gai Loh), Steamed Beef Tripe, Vegetables (usually Gai Lan or Green Beans in black bean sauce), and Pork Belly if we are extra hungry.  If you want to avoid the crowds during the weekend, get there between 10-11:30am; otherwise, be prepared to wait.

UIs_jYSYIem1OqBqOLVfQw.text: I personally love the dimsum here! They have all the basic dishes and some interesting ones of their own. I like that the wait isn't always atrociously long like at great wall in phx. The location seems cleaner and area is nicer. They automatically charge everyone a beverage fee (either tea or fountain drink but unlimited refill).

7GDUqIKqe4qeTyu8Bp0LCQ.text: Best Dim Sum in the Phoenix metro area. Great food and great service.  Best coconut and snow buns. I have been to MANY dim sum restaurants and Phoenix Palace is definitely the best!!

9T0sNTSmuW86a_7VhQYNaA.text: I would say the dim sum is pretty good during weekend but not the weekdays.   Food: The crepes of the rice rolls () were too thick..

USYqj8m-OHBSg1bf-v-IyA.text: Ok so I have never tried Dim Sum before and I will never eat it again. I tried a pork dish and it was like chewing wood. I could not get my teeth through the gritty wooden texture of this dish. I tried the sticky rice, it was ok, but there was a mushy center and it wasn't particularly tasty. There was two other dishes I tried. I don't remember the names of them but one of them has a clear coating around it, made me think of squid, which I actually like squid but this was mushy and tasteless. I ate three bites of my meal and left. $19.00 later I am so dissatisfied with my experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. I did not even finish what was on this plate. It was terrible.

2gTHntPbFFaSjrOiRm2Jhg.text: This is my new favorite place for Dim Sum in the valley.  We have dim sum at least once a month and have tried Great Wall, Golden Buddha, China King and C-Fu gourmet.  I believe that Phoenix Palace is the best of the bunch.  Here is why: 1.  Food quality:  Every dish was prepared perfectly.  Most were slightly above the other restaurants in term of taste.  There were exceptions (we like the shrimp stuffed eggplant best at C-Fu, and the chow mein better at Golden Buddha), but in general, this place was better. 2.  Cleanliness:  Not that other places are not clean, but this place was spotless 3.  Price:  We order almost the same thing at most dim sum restaurants as we have our favorite dishes.  We ordered more than usual here this morning to try some things (10 dishes total) and our bill was $25.78.  We usually average $33-$35 at the other places, and we brought quite a bit home 4.  Selection:  I have seen that the selection has decreased at the other places as their clientele diminishes.  For instance at Golden Buddha, one of the original dim sum places in the valley, you would wait at least 30 minutes if you did not get there before 11am.  Now it seems that the place is barely full, regardless of when you arrive.  As a result, the selection seems to have gone down.  At Phoenix Palace, we simply could not order everything.  When we left, there were still many things that we had still not tried.  We also had a few things that we had never had before (very surprising since we have dim sum so often) 5.  Location:  I live in the Ahwatukee area, so this is slightly closer than Golden Buddha, and far closer than Great Wall.

tWUHaYh-bHhNJsJZpKJb-g.text: Ok, not good or recommended if you are a vegetarian, but if you are not and like to share food...this is a nice place to come with friends and try different options from their dim sum!!! I don't remember even one name of the things I've tried, so yes...it was really useful to have a Chinese friend with us.

7cuUP8fiv7iN6MGsd_QcpQ.text: Not only surprised to even find Dim Sum in Phoenix but to find good Dim Sum was a great find!!!

i__0qmo1lxzB8WmFrPfa4A.text: Being from Orange County, I grew up eating at some really great Dim Sum places. Though this place doesn't quite have the variety and the atmosphere of other places I've been to, the food is pretty good. Being from Phoenix, it's a bit of a drive to come out here to eat, however, it's conveniently located in an shopping center with Lee Lee's (Asian grocery) and a Boba tea place. There's also a Pho restaurant in the same lot, though I've never tried it.

dKdTEOw_hKaPOOWthWCc8g.text: Dim sum was ok...hot tea cup is there for each plate...they will charge u all even if one person drinks!

uDxkw3mEYCintFYxUzuOtw.text: It's the best Chinese food I can find in Phoenix area and I am a Chinese. This place is no longer a buffet restaurant. I love their services, very considerate and kind, feel like family. And the dishes taste authentic Cantonese style. If you like Dim Sum, it's so delicious and so cheap! Definitely you should try.

UC0MSZ88gBWfrfSNBY8NsQ.text: Hands down best dim sum in the Valley. I've taken different groups of friends here on EVERY Sunday in the past two months, skipping only Easter, and have eaten like it's my last meal on Earth every time. All of my friends including Alex loved it and agree that it's the best dim sum in town right now. It's totally worth it even with the long drive from North Scottsdale and ridiculous weekend highway closures. Looks like I might be there again next Sunday...

UiiL3QOC9HSnJS3XevFqNQ.text: Jim W had an interesting thread the other day "what do you miss?" I don't miss many things about living in the bay, but getting my dim sum fix once a month or so is one of them. I had my office on Market St. and I had a Yank Sing in the alley right behind my building...I could go for dim sum at lunch, let the dishes pile up and waddle back to my office for nice long afternoon nap:) If I felt more ambitious, I could walk up to Chinatown to Delicious, New Fortune and Yong Kee for some of the most remarkable food this side of Hong Kong! It was especially pleasant when we got 4-5 of us to go, and just sit and talk and eat for couple of hours...the art of dim sum:) With that in mind, I headed out for the near reaches of Chandler this past Saturday. Jim and Audrey W. organized a dim sum outing at the Phoenix Palace Buffet (I frankly didn't notice the buffet...I'm sure it was there and very good...I was just too busy pointing at bamboo steamers and bowls and plates and saying "give me that one please":) Jim organized the outing after fellow Yelper Helen Y had noted that this place had changed ownership, chefs, etc., and is now quite good! (I now have 2 things to be grateful to Helen Y. for...helping us find good dim sum in greater Phoenix and allowing me to become a citizen of the Republic of Sweet:) We were joined on our outing by Kevin H (in an interesting side note, Kevin got ROTD for...Phoenix Palace Buffet on the exact same day that we went for dim sum!!! What are the odds!?:), Marian H. and Dottsy Z.  The Beautiful Carin wasn't able to make it...she had a little stomach bug and stayed in bed:(  I was going to stay home and take care of her, but the lure of potentially good dim sum was too great!:) Off I went with cheery wave and a lilting "feel better" hanging in the air as the door slammed before she changed her mind and asked me to stay around and nurse her back to health:) She's a strong girl...I knew she would pull through:) Boy, am I glad I went! The company and conversation were wonderful...everyone cheered me up about having to leave my better half at home (and as anyone who knows us will attest, Carin really is the better half...maybe the better 75%:) It was a perfect dim sum afternoon!  We talked, pointed at the carts, ate, talked and ate, talked and ate:)  I think dim sum is as much about conversation and relaxation as about the food...but having said that, having great food really adds to both the conversation and relaxation factor of a great dim sum lunch...and the food was remarkable! It was so good!  There might be a couple of shops that top this place in SFO, but not by much...it's that good! We had all the standards, shrimp rolls, pork buns, pork dumplings, shrimp dumplings, sticky rice (outstanding sticky rice, BTW). We had some of the non-standards, tripe, chive dumplings...all delicious and served up with smile! The service was very good...there were always carts in close proximity, and if you saw something a few tables away and flagged a server down, they always made their way over to help you out:) drinks were refilled promptly, and the empty dishes were moved out to make room for new arrivals. The biggest surprise came at the end of our lunch...the total for 6 of us was less than $70!!! I used to spend more than that for dim sum lunch for 2 in SFO (and twice that much in HK)! Amazing! Jim, thanks for organizing! It was a great lunch with a fun group! It's great to know where to get my dim sum fix!

68GIjOcKeBQnQpyXvuRyxQ.text: Only come here for Dim Sum for sit it.  Food was OK/good.  Should only come during weekends...not too many options come out during the week (don't blame them...not a consistent flow of customers).  The dim sum was good, but think it won't get better than this in AZ.  Had better in higher asian area/community (CA/WA).  Service is on the slower side, but wasn't expecting more from them.  Take out is not too much better, but convenient for busier days.  Person behind the counter don't seem like they want to work there...but who does.  Best place in east valley for Dim Sum, but only in AZ.

MIKxKh6AuKIG3dby_2VFAg.text: Friends from Cave Creek area were craving for some good  Chinese food and this is where we took them last night or took us since they paid for dinner.  Nothing fancy, but good American Chinese staple such as Mongolian Beef, Orange Chicken, Stir Fried Chinese Broccolli, Seafood Chowmein and Walnut Shrimp.  We have a thing about Family Style Dinner with lazy susans and they have it here.   For all that food that fed 4 adults and 3 kids with to go boxes was $57!  Can't beat that.  Complimentary hot tea is wonderful this time of the year.  The ingredients was fresh.   I don't know if they have a separate Chinese Menu.  No KID'S MENU, but there are several choices of noodle dishes to chose from.  The dim sum is decent, there's not much choices when we went on a weekday.  I assume they'd have more on the weekend.  We liked China KIng's Dim Sum, much better, but enjoyed the food off the menu at Phoenix more. This is an overall clean and consistent place to go and take your family to.  Oh, yeah, it's not a buffet!  I guess they used to be and never changed the name.

H53PrRRhBopYC5iVO4o7qg.text: Their dim sum is the best.  The shu Mai dumplings and shrimp dumplings are good but if you're more adventurest, try the tasty chicken feet and the delicious tripe, my family's favorite. The stuffed eggplant is excellent.  My dad's favorite is the turnip (daikon) cake. Our kids love the egg custard and the sweet pineapple buns for dessert.

EHgu0buiVb3bnj49rhNuLw.text: First off don't come here alone. Portions are for 2 or more and the menu doesn't offer more than one item and rice so it would be too much for one person to order 2 items. I ordered the Orange chicken because its a dish that is hard to screw up. Well despite the place being fairly empty and several staff on hand it seemed an eternity before any one took my order. Once my food arrived I dug in only to find the chicken flavorless with barely a hint of orange. It tasted more like sweet and sour sauce of the grocery store variety. I ate 1/5 the plate a decided I could do better at home with a packet of spicy seafood ramen. In the time it has taken for the wait staff to notice that I had given up on their tasteless dish to the time I received the cheque has been an eternity. I will never eat here again and I recommend that you don't waste you time or money. There is a plaque at the front door that claims best of Phoenix... I doubt they would win that award today.

K2pT0OgMmEEkMbNdMyyAoQ.text: The food is not bad - their egg tarts are really good and their food is fresh only if you get in right before the rush. But the reason for the low rating is that I'm pretty peeved/annoyed at the service I was given today. I even brought in new friends to try out the place and give them more business. Many times  I had to get up and ask for the things we wanted- like water, chili oil, we were pretty much ignored (and I get that, there's some prejudice when you have non-asians -its harder for the servers to communicate with each other). The worst was when I had to walk up to get the bill, get the bill, then return to pay for it. We had 4 cards to pay that was going to end up being over $50 (plus tip), and at first they wouldn't accept our payment. I have never before been refused this request when I was here a month ago. I get that they're annoyed with paying the extra merchant fee, but honestly it's only a few extra cents and it's not like we would each only be paying $5-10 on our card. Plus, it's not that they're dying and going out of business, nor did they have a sign saying this was not allowed. I went up to the manager and he just grabbed the cards in my hands while rolling his eyes at me. After I got our receipts back, I found out that he overcharged each of us by a few dollars, without letting me know... I ended up tipping less than I normally do because I'm pretty annoyed at this kind of service. I don't mind paying more to use my credit card, but all you have to do is treat your customers with an explanation. I also run a business and understand that costs are costs, but don't be cheap about it when you have about 100 other customers in the restaurant, making it look like you're making quite the profit running up other people's credit cards.

sxhCQWFg0tOQUnwlOUlYhw.text: Today was my very first visit on Friday after Thanksgiving at 11:40am. The place was full like a weekend. I thought the hagow and shrimp and scallop dumplings had very thick skins, so I discarded them and just ate the fillings. There were no sui mai for an hour and just the same 2 carts going around and around. The sui mai were okay, but lacked shrimp and tasted a bit bland. Finally, some ham shui gok's (fried footballs stuffed with meat) came along with some sesame balls. We ordered the fried footballs and they were stone cold! I told the cart lady and she just shrugged her shoulders, like saying what could she do? Finally some panfried turnip cake came around and it was also cold. The trays of baked goodies came around often and they all looked very good, but we are more fans of the savory, rather than sweet so we felt that the variety was lacking in that department. We never saw any bean curd meat rolls, or stuffed peppers in black bean sauce either?I would give this place another try, but right now I feel The China King had better tasting dim sum plus you can order the fried footballs and turnip cake off the menu and know it will be hot upon arrival. The service staff were also rushing around past our table and that was a bit distracting. Maybe they were not expecting such a large crowd for a Friday?

6t2DBf2JN1DcnTgPurLsgA.text: Man oh Man!   Since leaving New York six and a half years ago I have been in search of good Chinese Food.  I had gotten to the point where I would have even settled for "decent".  A work colleague suggested that we dine here on the way to a corporate meeting.  While I realized that he was a native to the Phoenix Metro Area and had probably never even had the real thing, I trusted his palate and restaurant sense.  I was so pleased when we walked in and saw that the diners were predominately Asian.  I knew that  a great  Asian market was next door as well and these things were the first things that signaled to me that I was probably going to get good food.  I was thrilled to see familiar Dim Sum carts rolling through.  We were a party of 7 and shared around.  The food was fantastic!  Dim sum was fresh and succulent.  Our orders from the menu were equally delicious.  The veggies were fresh and brightly colored.  The tastes distinctive and delicious.  The Hot and Sour Soup was perfect filled with all kinds of Chinese mushrooms etc.  I was delighted and reminisced about the many fantastic dinners in Chinatown NY. This food was comparable.  I do not live close by, but I will be a regular there.  Chandler is clear on the other side of the World from me but I figure if Marco Polo could do it, so can I!  Phoenix Palace is the REAL Thing!!!  Friendly prompt service rounded out the experience.  Hooray for Phoenix Palace!

LUfPzeuIPmFLLZ2IaIxkSg.text: When we arrived, there were no host to greet us. Later a lady asked me to be seated. I have told her we are a party of two. She told me to wait and I have seen people running after the staffs to check out (Service Failure). They didn't have the supreme broth dumpling where a signature dim sum place would have in most exquisite places. Compare with those places in Hong Kong, California, and New York, this is a huge step down. The service is always a weak sector of a Asian restaurant and this is no exception because service people are treated like a slave (low people and their face and attitudes reflects that as well). When you have to ask for everything from water, tea refills, even the basic items of the dim sum, it has already lost two stars with me. The seaweed salad is filled with artificial food color which made me sick to my stomach (the dye spill over the sesame seeds). I have ordered duck tongue, crispy roast duck, and jelly fish which are just OK. This place will never survive in California, due to lack of real competition (China King, SIFU, and Golden Budda), it is a winner by default so I will hope to see other giants who will come over here. Even Albuquerque had better dim sum than this.

tacCUaBPZsic_oL6iX7A7A.text: I really want to give NO STAR. This is absolutely the worst restaurant ever. No service. Had to get my own water jug to pour my own water.  and the food is absolutely horrible. i wouldn't call it chinese food. i wouldn't even call it asian food. It's edible. that all i can say.  It's a restaurant to fool white people who never had real chinese cuisine.  It's lucky its in AZ, because if this food court were in CA, it would never survive.  NO chinese ppl with a decent palate will ever walk into this imitation panda express which is worse than panda express.  i feel sorry for AZ residents where good cuisine is really lacking.

3KIXGbM6OUZF7HR19AuBng.text: Loved this place.  My best friend recommended it, she comes here every Sunday for dim sum brunch.  Service was fast, the carts came by every so often and almost everything we had was delicious - sticky rice, shrimp balls, shu-mai, pork buns, spare ribs and roast duck!  And best of all?  We paid only over $25+  for so much food!  A must try!

OgwcpkOYoP-qzCV8S99mXA.text: Love the cleanliness , service and variety they cater for Dim Sum. So far the best dim sum I've tried in Phoenix. Highly recommended!

OL2BrMTnUTZkUUP0cULn3w.text: I have frequent this dim sum restaurants for 10 years.  I think have great food and friendly staff.  Today, the first time we have a bad experience.  My wife and I were having a great dim sum lunch there, when we were about to leave, we saw a bus person cleaning a table across from us in a very unclean way.  He just simply poured left over tea from a tea pot onto the table and used the used tablecloth to clean the table.  The owner of the restaurant happened to be nearby, so we called him over and showed him what the bus person was doing.  The owner simply look at us in surprise, and asked us "so, what's your problem?"  I tried to explain to him that as a customer, I expect the table to be cleaned with some sort of disinfectant, not left over tea pouring on a table, and definitely not with a the used tablecloth.  He just look at us and said he rather does this instead of using unsafe chemicals.  At that point, we decided the simplest course for us was to leave, and never to come back.  If what we see in the public area was unclean, then how do we know what sort of thing they do in the kitchen?  maybe the kitchen God there can give us a hint someday.  Anyway, they just lost a customer!  /Nchu

w6jclyLgzF0csh3P3aWhYA.text: Charged for water. Funny how that exists when the food is overly oily and salty, and Arizona gets to 110+ degrees in the summer.

xoFwvpJiaJ4AzV8k3mMRDg.text: The Dim sum was great. We ordered what we thought would cost $300 and it was just $190. Oh, the food very good. We will be back for sure.

RNBaGBNuDYkv0giWxh9ckQ.text: Excellent Chinese food, friendly and attentive service, and very spacious restaurant ideal for large groups. My extended family and I came here to help celebrate a group birthday. We were really pleased with the experience and were surprised to find good Chinese cuisine so far form our home in New York. Highly recommend.

oi2p1HCqykVJp2L3aaV-ww.text: We finally had time to try dim sum here. We came in around 2 pm on Saturday and were seated right away. As soon as we sat down we had 3 push carts by our table (all at once) offering dishes to us. I wanted to get my hot tea first but that came later. We ordered few dishes and kindly told them that was enough for now. Not 5 minutes later, we had 2 more carts pointing things out to us. Not to mention one lady placing dishes we didn't order on our table. We had to tell her 'No' firmly. Another time, we had to say 'no' like 4 times before we can get her to leave us alone to enjoy what was already table full of food. I have never experienced such pushy dim sum ladies in my life.  Food wise, few dishes were lukewarm (expected given the time we arrived) but others were still steaming hot. We were also very hungry and we could've eaten anything at that point. My favorite was the egg noodles stir fried. Everything else was as expected.   I would love to come back here but those ladies are a big turn off for me. Dim sum is meant to be enjoyed leisurely reading a newspaper. If I were to come back, I'd come during their peak time so that they'd be too busy to be harassing us.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Dim sum

mfPnDE_MuEwYB7QKQHwYBg.text: When our favorite dim sum place seem too far this is where we come to satisfy our dim sum cravings. The service is a hit or miss but their food is consistent. They run out of egg custard fast so if you're ever craving them... go when they first open.

zNzbuiMd6HxcR5MdtcW0YQ.text: I normally don't do yelp reviews because I understand that everyone has off days, but after a trip here with family, I actually felt inspired to write a review. I am a server in the food service industry, so I know what good service looks like and this place doesn't have it. From the start you get the vibe that the employees feel burdened by you. We waited for 30 minutes, received no menus and spent 20 minutes asking for a single sprite, only to be ignored not one, not two, not even three, but for four times. It got to a point where we just had to get up and leave. They were not busy, maybe with 6 or 7 tables. For all I know they could have had decent food, but it's hard to tell when they neglect to serve you. I'd recommend finding somewhere else to get your Chinese food.

kIO6KueUwUlpDAmw-IWT0w.text: I'll admit I'm not a huge fan of eating here for dinner, but I've lived in Phoenix my entire life and this is my favorite place for dim sum. While everything is great, I especially love their pork buns and dumplings. I'm so confused by lower reviews- I can't help but think that the people rating it a 1 are used to eating Panda Express

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States

hwt3z-DbBQsMM-XrV0F_CA.text: Went back again today and found ourselves  in a mystery called who shrunk the food. Buns shrimp ball all about half the size they used to be.  Shrimp ball skins much thicker than they should be and very chewy.  Quite  a disappointment over what it used to be  earlier this year.

tVu0JbvhijqyiZupEVk2Qw.text: This is my parent's go to spot for dimsum in Phoenix, but we decided to try out the dinner here one day when I was home for the holidays.   We arrived around 6 pm on New Years Day expecting a short wait, but the restaurant was almost completely empty. It doesn't seem like dinner service here is that popular, even though there's always a wait for dimsum around lunch time.  We ordered 3 dishes to share family style:  Beef chow fun ($10.75) - always such a classic dish, and they do it well here. The beef was very tender and flavored just right.  Hot braised sliced fish ($12.25) - I was disappointed by this dish. We asked our server about this dish before ordering, and she said nothing about it being braised in a sweet and sour sauce (and neither did the description on the menu). I don't like sweet and sour dishes and definitely would not have ordered it had I known. Though I do highly recommend for people who like this type of flavor as the fish itself was fresh and comes coated generously with sauce.  Black bean sauce spare ribs ($10.50) - enjoyed this dish as well. The ribs were tender and came with plenty of bell peppers and onions.  There was a complimentary dessert at the end of the meal of sweet taro soup, which is one of my favorite Chinese dessert soups.  Overall, my parents and I liked Phoenix Palace for dinner and would come back again. Prices for cheap for the portions that we got; the restaurant definitely didn't skimp on the meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States
Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Black bean sauce spare ribs ($10.50)
Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Hot braised sliced fish ($12.25)

Fq6Lwp-ayk7wCOAWUnyvpA.text: This restaurant is definitely better at dim sum compared to their dinner. It is very busy when it's weekend lunch rush (which is when they serve dim sum) and the food is authentic and has decent quality. On the other hand, their dinner is sub-par at best. Here are the dishes that we ordered during a Friday night dinner: - Roast Duck: came out at room temperature, did not have as crispy skin as I would have preferred, but was okay - Beef Chow Fun w/ Egg Sauce: lacking flavor, but the beef was alright - Beef Cubes w/ Black Pepper Sauce: a bit overpowering but was the most flavorful dish of the night

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Roast Duck

oiKRtk0N1i4UFGaMbFPOUA.text: Sucks. No services. No respects. No tastes. So disappointed. I was asking for soup and the waitress even tried to full me saying she doesn't know what kind of soup they have. Alright I wouldn't order anything if I don't even know what it is. No wonder why they don't have any customers in the evening dinner time.

6qiPenY1CgVbvVoaKtdrXA.text: We heard this was the best dim sum place in Phoenix. Maybe because it was a Monday but this place is terrible. There is no excuse for awful service, the dim sum was fair and the variety was equally bad.   We will never return.

pD0XMB58pSIgo8iSJUgUIw.text: Yeah man!  This is LA Chinatown quality DIM SUM!  (And then sum..)  Same grease, flavor, and bang for the buck!    Good customer service, although the ladies pushing the carts try a little too hard to sell.  (Let the food sell itself.)  The decor was a little odd though.  Looks like they do special events here or something....  But over all,  this place packs it in!!!!  Thumbs Up!!!!

Z61T_l2OlQLpS3R7f5S7pg.text: We got seated after waiting awhile for a table, which was ok. Its expected, dim sum restaurants are always busy. When we got seated, waitress and nor waitors didn't even go to our table so we can order drinks. Took forever to flag someone down. All the carts didn't even make its round to our table, it was so disappointed. Food was overpriced and quality sucks. Next time I should just go to great wall for dim sum.

zeTjdGdh8B0_fWlzW46hkQ.text: This is definitely a place to skip. The help is terrible. The manager is one nasty woman! I came in for dinner with a friend. We each ordered appetizers. He ordered crab puffs and I ordered Roast Pork. His crab puffs came out in 8 minutes. 25 minutes later my Roast Pork was still not here. I asked the waiter. He went to see why my order was still not at the table. He then told me that the chef was too busy taking care of the to go orders.  10 minutes later nothing came. I canceled my appy as my dinner was now coming to the table. Mind you that the Roast Pork was already cooked, it just had to be cut.  After dinner I asked to speak to the manager. Up walks this little nasty woman. "What? What you want?" "This about the Pork?" Yes I said.  "Yeah, chef too busy" Really I said. And as manager you don't even come over to apologize? Is it not the manager that should be apologizing? "Too busy"  There were three tables of diners including our table.   Take my word, go elsewhere. I will be.

aRWOlhO1ws05MAaPil0z3A.text: Been here a handful of times, never had a problem with the food. Service is a hit or miss, but dim sum places are always on the unfriendly side from personal experience (aside from ding tai feng).   The most recent time I came here was with a group of 20. One of the people made a reservation so we were seated pretty quickly without any issues despite how busy it was. The carts came swarming before everyone got here. I was pleasantly surprised with the frequency of the cart visits. Each cart minded their own business, though - if you ask for something that they don't have, they'll just tell you to wait.   We ordered the shrimp dumplings, shumai, sweet rice chicken wrapped in lotus leaf, ribs, turnip cake, and lots of desserts. I recommend the turnip cake and the shrimp dumplings! With a table of 10, we spent 116 with tax and tips included. Good pricing for the amount of food we ordered!

BzjCu1AZ-T37fowaUsPhMw.text: Are you fcking kidding me. Two fcking dead flies in my roast duck. So fckin gross n disgusting. Will report to health department.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Two dead flies on the roast duck. Ewwwww

6wIU29agoTU-Nvx0hGt6sg.text: Prologue: I've dined at this restaurant for dim sum a few times in the past, however my fiancee had not and so we decided to give it a try together.  The Plot: We ordered several of our usual favorite dim sum, including Pai Gwut (steamed pork ribs), Fong Djau (steamed chicken feet), Nor Mai Gai (sticky rice in lotus leaf), and Ngau Paak Yip (steamed beef tripe). We also tried a couple of items that were new for us, including Baked Pineapple Roll with Egg Custard Filling and Cake Roll with Shredded Pork Filling.  The Scene: My impression after this visit on the weekend is that their Dim Sum dining is now noticeably better, and consequently busier, than on my previous visits. In particular was a greater variety of deserts, including the Baked Pineapple Roll mentioned above. Anyone who is a fan of Daan Taat (Egg Tarts) should enjoy the Pineapple Roll as much as we did. My fiancee, who is a native of mainland China, and I have never before had a dim sum item like the Cake Roll with Shredded Pork. The opportunity to try either one of these items would make a visit to this restaurant worthwhile.  The Rest of the Story: The restaurant was very busy on a weekend afternoon; however we were seated within reasonable amount of time. The service was prompt and courteous and the prices are standard for this level of dim sum.  Epilogue: As good as this place is now while also being so close to home, this is now our go to place for weekend dim sum.  Photo design by Billie Z.

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States. Baked Pineapple Roll with Egg Custard Filling and Cake Roll with Shredded Pork Filling

1uXSHtNKkxm8_A2r0sGEXQ.text: Pretty good dim sum spot, except you can rack up a pretty hefty bill!   So there's mostly only a couple of spots to get dim sum in Phoenix that I consider note-worthy: Great Wall (too far for me), Mekong, and Phoenix Palace.   I usually go to Mekong but I decided a change of scenery was good because my parents usually like going to Phoenix palace!   First things first, the service is way better here than at Mekong. Mostly because the square footage that the cart pushers have to cover is a lot less! I also enjoyed the difference menu options that I'm usually not used to seeing at Mekong!  Everything was hot, and most of the food was good, some of it was hit or miss though. Like for instance the har gao (shrimp rice ball) was super tiny, compared to other places that have it. However the shu mai (pork meat dumpling) was huge compared to the other places!  To lo mai kai (sticky rice) was actually kinda dry, which was odd!   However the service definitely makes up for just some of the foods that didn't taste as good as I get from other places! I will say though that the prices of some dishes are a lot more pricey than it's competitors like Mekong, which I believe is a flat rate for most of the normal dishes.   All in all, I'm kinda torn between whether I'd come here or not. Overall it was a great experience, but I also spent $116 treating out my family, which usually id end up with a $80 at Mekong. Try both, and see which one you like!

photos.caption: Photo of Phoenix Palace - Chandler, AZ, United States

-NHWFgnUeMAB55H7a4cOKA.text: First time here for dim sum and very impressed. Been to many of these over the years and they're right up there with them all.   Of course, the usual language problems and the tendency to try to overload us with everything on the cart, but that's to be expected. But the food was real good and especially the pork buns were quite loaded.   Just be sure you know what you're getting - we wound up with a hot dog dim sum, LOL.   Go with a crowd if you can, and try to stay away from the first table near the door.

FviAqN-pB1-MojGbyzFK-Q.text: The food is good, but the service is Horrible, had to wait 20 min just for someone to tell that we needed to order and that's after my girlfriend waved someone down like an SOS on the freeway, I never got a refill at all on my iced tea!! Will never go there again!!

naEzw6MDyEks0tmW068ABA.text: The food was great and tasty. We ordered a glass of house wine, when time came up for payment, we were charged $8.25 per glass (It is way to pricy for this type of restaurant). Just drink the Tea...good luck..

_Pb_JKFQ5X8-RNko1mXsdw.text: Went there last Sunday for the first time, as were heard the Dim Sum is very good, and I as was surprise it was one of the most authentic Chinese restaurants in Scottsdale!!! For you first timers, there are no directions once you are seated, the nice ladies come around to your table with their carts and they tell you ( the best they can) what they are serving. Once you say yes, they put their mark on the ticket. I would have liked more veg and noodle dishes, but was unaware until after we were finished eating that you can order different foods directly from the kitchen!!! The food was great, service was really good, great family experience, affordable, and plenty of parking- BUT come early on Sundays it gets CROWDED!!! This place is a gotta try!!!TS

ccvXl_MqpwnxlMWgnrqsJw.text: Is it the best? No. Is it consistent? Yes. If they don't have the item in the dimsum cart, they're willing to make it for you without giving you grief. Never had dinner here so I can't comment on that but am willing to try in the future.

VOv5Iv_mtCjRVLg11pIuAQ.text: Decent Dim Sum, but some minor quality improvements would easily put it into a best of Phoenix category. For example, BBQ pork buns were over baked. Same for the sesame balls.  Shrimp balls need to improve on texture. Additional condiments would be appreciated - how does one get spicy mustard here?

GYXQOdIburb5KxFSp3QPyA.text: This place is probably the best dim sum I've had in Arizona...... Nowhere near Cali standards..but when the husband and I need a dim sum fix, this is the place we go to! Haven't tried their dinner... So can not speak about that!

a-qKS6yja6j48g2aBbEv0w.text: The dim sum here are better at the moment, used to be unappealing. There is definitely something wrong with the shrimp fried rice. I continually tried to give them chances after chances to improve, but all 3 times the shrimps had this pee-like taste and smell! They are definitely not fresh, but rather long-dead and smelly!
